[{"id":"QCT-1519","entityId":"66-5567","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"I18N Signal Type in PolarizationPage title"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"created","value":"1589803589603"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1519"},{"name":"description","value":"
PolarizationPage.getTitle() should fetch the string from the language resource!
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"boj"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"boj"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589803589603"},{"name":"Type","value":["Refactoring"],"valueId":["Refactoring"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Ready"],"valueId":["Ready"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_cct_2_20"],"valueId":["2020_cct_2_20"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.8"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.8"],"color":null},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["120"],"valueId":["2h"],"color":null}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1498","entityId":"66-5516","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Add error handling to qlite"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"created","value":"1588874734477"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1498"},{"name":"description","value":"

If result of some commands and requests sent to Qlite is not successful, then Qlite will send and error message beginning with "!". Right now we are not using this information and just ignore it. We can read this information and save it in a property with name of error message (We can add the name of rule to the beginning of the error message.). We have to check which commands sent back error message and add this to all of them.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589796939005"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"QCT-1518","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"QCT-1360","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"QCT-1268","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["1440"],"valueId":["3d"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6300","author":"vse","authorFullName":"Viktor Selleby","issueId":"QCT-1498","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

The modem can inform us on most error states via the commands: alarm show active unit/rx/tx. These commands have caused communication errors and can because of this only be triggered via the Property Client. When this issue is implemented, the commands should be made periodic again and we should do something useful with the information reported by them.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1589287690361,"updated":1589288388654,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[{"value":"Has ToDo in CodeBase","cssClass":"c4"}]}, {"id":"QCT-1268","entityId":"66-4069","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Full support for Q-Lite"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"created","value":"1558511409551"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1268"},{"name":"description","value":"
This will add the possibility to select predefined slots containing configurations (from now on these shall be called configuration memory).

A configuration memory is identified by a text string. The administrator shall configure the modem and save its setting into a configuration memory with a certain name using the web interface of the modem. This name must then be entered into the Setup of the QCT to be used. There shall be a new field in the QLite Setup where the administrator shall be able to add a comma separated list of names.

There shall also be a field specifying the default configuration memory.

These names shall then be available in a dialog. This dialog can be accessed from a button in the lower parts of the QCT screen between the alarm button and the right button. This means that it shall be possible for the operator to choose a new configuration memory at any time.

This dialog shall contain a scrollable list of the names of the configuration memories that were specified by the administrator in the Setup. The operator selects a new configuration memory by tapping on the corresponding name.
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Problem Description

The modem can inform us on most error states via the commands: alarm show active unit/rx/tx. These commands have caused communication errors and can because of this only be triggered via the Property Client. When this issue is implemented, the commands should be made periodic again and we should do something useful with the information reported by them.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589796938980"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"QCT-1498","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"QCT-1268","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Ready"],"valueId":["Ready"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["480"],"valueId":["1d"],"color":null}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1108","entityId":"66-3529","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Not possible to downgrade database"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"created","value":"1536225263448"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1108"},{"name":"description","value":"
This means that it will not be possible to install a previous version where the database version is less than the current one.

For instance, in 1.4 the database version is 4. In 1.5 the version will be 5. So it will be possible to upgrade from 1.4 to 1.5 but not downgrade from 1.5 to 1.4.

If a typo is made in the beacon frequency field when creating a setup file, it is currently difficult to detect. The allowed beacon frequency should span from min lnb lo + 950 000 000 to max lnb lo + 2 000 000 000.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589792302136"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1589791978174"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"QCT-1517","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Usability Problem"],"valueId":["Usability Problem"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Verified"],"valueId":["Verified"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"vse","fullName":"Viktor Selleby"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["120"],"valueId":["2h"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6312","author":"vse","authorFullName":"Viktor Selleby","issueId":"QCT-1459","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
A quick fix has been implemented where values between 7.0GHZ and 21.2GHz are accepted. A default value of 10.7 GHz has been set to avoid forcing the user to enter a value if beacon is not used as signal source. The default value should be restored to 0 again once QCT-1517 is implemented.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1589792302136,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1517","entityId":"66-5563","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Only show Beacon Frequency field in setup file if beacon is used as signal source"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"created","value":"1589792158529"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1517"},{"name":"description","value":"

The Beacon Frequency is only used if beacon is used as signal source. To avoid confusion, this field should be hidden if signal source is not beacon. When this is done, the default value of the field could be restored to 0 so that the user is forced to change the value to be able to save.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589792175241"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"QCT-1459","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["New"],"valueId":["New"],"color":null},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1516","entityId":"66-5561","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Tuning page doesn't show even if SignalSource is modem or beacon while starting up."},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"created","value":"1589556161169"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1516"},{"name":"description","value":"

If Signal source is none then Tuning page wille not be shown. But even if Tuning page is modem or Beacon, if we are rebooting system the signal source will not be shown until we change setup file.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1589199409992,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6306","author":"vse","authorFullName":"Viktor Selleby","issueId":"QCT-1485","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

A possible solution was discussed during a meeting with @Viktor Selleby @Bengt-Ove Johansson @Govan Marounsi @Jonas Lindberg @Fredrik Jonsson @Magnus Andersson where the LED on tuning page turns red if there is no communication with the signal source.

When Modem is used as signal source the text under the led should be Modem instead of RX.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1589459872696,"updated":1589459950234,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6311","author":"vse","authorFullName":"Viktor Selleby","issueId":"QCT-1485","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

In addition to the LED, a describing text e.g. Waiting For Modem/Beacon should be displayed under or next to the Page Title on Tuning and Transmit pages.

Affected Hardware Configuration (IDs for TU, NP, AS, CU, AUX)

CU

Affected Software Version(s)

Urgency

Urgent

Problem Description

The SDRPlay RSP2 receiver that is being used as Beacon receiver. Supplier is referring to that the RSPdx is the replacement unit.
A quick test with a Pi3 flash image showed that its not direct compatible, Pi3 with the RSPdx didnt started correctly.

See the home page for more details
https://www.sdrplay.com/rspdx/

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"mad"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"4"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589535747260"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1589535747249"},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Minor"],"valueId":["Minor"],"color":{"bg":"#e6e6e6","fg":"#888"}},{"name":"State","value":["Verified"],"valueId":["Verified"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Edition","value":["Normal Edition"],"valueId":["Normal Edition"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"Branch","value":["maintenance-2.19"],"valueId":["maintenance-2.19"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6120","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"DEV-2885","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

At the bottom of the page it says:

Please note, the RSPdx will only work with SDRuno running on Windows initially, and SDRuno is needed to unlock the full features of the RSPdx.

On another page (https://www.sdrplay.com/some-guidance-for-linux-and-gnu-radio-users/) they say that the RSPdx only can be used with API 3.06 and we're currently using 2.1x, so we need to upgrade the application to that API. Another page states that the 3.06 for Raspberry Pi is in Open Beta for Developers only which indicates that there might still be problems with that version.

I think the best way forward is to try with the new API. Then we need to decide how we should support the two different versions in the software.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1578582452662,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6121","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"DEV-2885","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I have asked about the Linux support and they refer back to this webpage update.
https://www.sdrplay.com/happy-new-year-and-an-rspdx-update/

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1578639409242,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6132","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"DEV-2885","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

SDRPlay has another proposal, the RSP1A is a updated product with the same performance as the RSP2. The board size is only 2mm wider and fit into our screen box.
The RSP1A is supported with our existing driver 2.13. First test has shown that its probably feasible to have a SW to support both the RSP2 and RSP1A.
The RSP1A HW ID=255 and it doesnt support external reference or multiple inputs.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1579858440858,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6309","author":"vse","authorFullName":"Viktor Selleby","issueId":"DEV-2885","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Support has been implemented and briefly tested. Has to be verified in a real system.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1588671783303,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6308","author":"vse","authorFullName":"Viktor Selleby","issueId":"QCT-1468","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

If the Admin dialog is opened directly after a software update, the webserver is displayed as "Off", however, the webserver is actually running.

If the webserver is set to "On" in the GUI, the webserver is stopped. Thus, to ensure that the state of the webserver matches the state of the button the user has to select "On" then "Off" and finally "On" again.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589472925030"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1589472925024"},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Verified"],"valueId":["Verified"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Release","value":["1.7.0"],"valueId":["1.7.0"],"color":null},{"name":"Fixed in RC","value":["RC6"],"valueId":["RC6"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"vse","fullName":"Viktor Selleby"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["960"],"valueId":["2d"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6275","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"QCT-1477","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1588672208228,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1491","entityId":"66-5501","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"CPU Usage unreasonably high after installation"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"created","value":"1588852337054"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1491"},{"name":"description","value":"

After new software is installed via the web gui the CPU usage of the system is unreasonably high 95-99% even though the system is idle.

If a reboot is performed, either via power cycle or adb reboot, the idle CPU usage on a board drops to 4-5%.

Investigate what causes this. If no other solution is found a possible fix could be to always reboot the system after installation is completed.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"2"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589468836763"},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["Ready"],"valueId":["Ready"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Blocked"],"valueId":["Blocked"],"color":{"bg":"#8d5100","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["1440"],"valueId":["3d"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6293","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"QCT-1491","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Try to get a profiler up and running on the app. Timebox this attempt and if it fails, implement a reboot from the software after a complete install.

Affected Hardware Configuration (IDs for TU, NP, AS, CU, AUX)

TU Ku 6W

Affected Software Version(s)

1.7.0 RC1

Problem Description

For BUC without any M&C for o/p readings we cant display values on the Transmit Page.
Should be empty or N/A marked.
If we have a integrated modem we could calculate a output power based on the known gain and a known i/p signal level.

For the Ku 6W a EIRP value is shown and doesn't change when the gain button are adjusted.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"mad"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"vse"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589458785995"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"QCT-1512","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"boj","fullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["480"],"valueId":["1d"],"color":null},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image1588849971327.png","id":"85-1582","url":"http://dps-sw-youtrack.corp.datapath.com:8999/_persistent/image1588849971327.png?file=85-1582&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6280","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"QCT-1462","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1588849987702,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1361","entityId":"66-4239","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"950MP C/N 0.4dB"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Magnus Andersson"},{"name":"created","value":"1562854399481"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1361"},{"name":"description","value":"

Two of the modem doesnt fulfill the modem spec to have the RSSI P4:16 level of< 2300 when its unlocked. These two modem Sno 2207 and 2233 had 2308 when it was unlocked therefore the transmit page have the min value of 0.4 even when the modem is unlocked.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Magnus Andersson"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"mad"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"3"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"mad"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589446060261"},{"name":"resolved","value":"1588231984611"},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["System Tested"],"valueId":["System Tested"],"color":{"bg":"#0050a1","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Release","value":["1.7.0"],"valueId":["1.7.0"],"color":null},{"name":"Fixed in RC","value":["RC4"],"valueId":["RC4"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"Planned Release","value":["1.7.0"],"valueId":["1.7.0"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["120"],"valueId":["2h"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-5990","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"QCT-1361","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

iDirect has responded back,
. The voltage range for the demod unlocked state is from 0-2.3V, not 2.2. Thus there is no gap between the demod locked vs demod unlocked state. It was not intended to be an indicator for demod lock.
This means that we need to have an offset of the conversion, SNR conversion table to be valid from 2350-4600 see QCT-1350

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1570170064218,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6302","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"QCT-1361","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

To verify this the modem must have had a receive lock and then loose the signal. Modem will then show C/N 0.4dB until modem is rebooted which happens quite often when it doesnt receive a lock.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1589446037506,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-6303","author":"mad","authorFullName":"Magnus Andersson","issueId":"QCT-1361","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

RC5 fixed the issue

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1589446054207,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1511","entityId":"66-5547","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Android-build should fail if Qct.apk or QctWebServer.apk fails"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"created","value":"1589360275104"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1511"},{"name":"description","value":"

Even if the builds on qct-build, Qct.apk and QctWebServer.apk, fails android-build continues to build the .qcti artifact. If Qct.apk or QctWebServer.apk are not present, the android-build should fail as well.

Problem Description

Users don't need to be aware that there is a Service login. The authentication page for server and admin should be the same. But when user is logged in as service it should be possible that in the wizard go back to the service page, otherwise user should just see the admin settings.

Affected Hardware Configuration (IDs for TU, NP, AS, CU, AUX)

L-band TU Ku 6W

Affected Software Version(s)

1.7.0 RC4

Problem Description

No update on the histogram after the SW upgrade.

Steps to Reproduce the Problem

The unit had RC3 installed and I installed RC4, the unit was operational and could transmit but no beacon signal.
Power cycle fixed the issue, and beacon and RSSi values are shown in the histogram.
